h3. Problem Definition
We have a customer request where they need to set a lower timeout value for REST API calls without modifying the global timeout value.


h3. Suggested Solution
Since the boolean logout flag needs to be implemented by third-party caller, the request is for this feature to be implemented in Confluence.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41425].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When you access a Space, the sidebar is blank and Space Tools is missing. 

This message is seen in the logs
{code}
2017-02-01 11:31:42,989 ERROR [ajp-nio-8009-exec-121] [plugin.descriptor.web.ConfluenceWebInterfaceManager] getHtml Failed to render web panel: com.atlassian.plugin.web.descriptors.DefaultWebPanelModuleDescriptor$ContextAwareWebPanel@40857e64
 -- url: /display/KEY/Page | page: 4260294 | traceId: 5589811101dedf7a | userName: username | referer: https://confluence.company.com/spacedirectory/view.action | action: viewpage
java.lang.RuntimeException: Entities can only be used with a single EntityManager instance
{code}

h3. Environment
Confluence 1000.27.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Be on a instance with duplicate entry in AO_187CCC_SIDEBAR_LINK table (unknown how to reproduce this step)
# Access a Space
# The sidebar is showing blank and Space Tools is missing

h3. Expected Results
* Confluence Sidebar and Space Tools should be visible

h3. Actual Results
* Confluence Sidebar is blank and Space Tools is missing
 
h2. Resolution
# Verify if there is a Duplicate Entry in "AO_187CCC_SIDEBAR_LINK" 
{code}select * from "AO_187CCC_SIDEBAR_LINK" where "CATEGORY" = 'ADVANCED' AND "SPACE_KEY"='{SPACEKEY}';{code}
{code}select * from "AO_187CCC_SIDEBAR_LINK" where "CATEGORY" = 'MAIN' AND "SPACE_KEY"='{SPACEKEY}';{code}
# Once duplicate entry is identified, delete the duplicate entry by running the command:
{code}delete from "AO_187CCC_SIDEBAR_LINK" where "ID" = {ID of the duplicate entry};{code}
# Flush cache

Note: _Don't forget to backup the database_
fields.summary: Confluence Sidebar is blank and Space Tools is missing on some instances

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41403].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
[Running Confluence Over SSL or HTTPS|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/running-confluence-over-ssl-or-https-161203.html]

We've had some customers describing this article to be overly complex using the basic tools.

h3. Suggested Solution
When considering some third-party tools or even open source tools, the process is made much simpler. In this case the customer used a very well known open source tool called Keytool Explorer.

As it's understandable that we cannot promote third-party tools, we could at least acknowledge/encourage the user to seek out these tools as we do with other documentation. (ex. database migration)
fields.summary: Improve SSL/HTTPS configuration documentation using external tools
Add Templates to a space without having admin access to the space

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41399].
  {panel}

Currently, the JIRA Issue Macro seems to contain a limitation - that, unless a user is in the "jira-users" group on JIRA, it is impossible for them to view JIRA issues presented by the JIM plugin, even though the JIRA project in question is open for anonymous browse access.

However, it appears that this is supported in the underlying metadata by adding the "<ac:parameter ac:name="anonymous">true</ac:parameter>" (using the Confluence Metadata Editor).

The only problem with this is that it gets wiped out if you ever perform an Edit/Save on the inserted JIM. Currently, the only solution we've found for this is to reapply the metadata edit.

I believe this could be resolved in a couple of ways

# the JIM editor sucks in the existing metadata, updates only what's changed and writes it all back out - thus persisting any underlying metadata edits or
# (my preferred solution) - the JIM plugin is updated to expose the anonymous setting as an "Allow anonymous access" checkbox. The default would be as "unchecked" to replicate current behaviour but ticking the checkbox would cause the insertion of the "anonymous=true" parameter in the underlying metadata. If that setting already exists in the metadata then, when the JIM is edited in the future, it's current value is exposed in the setting of the checkbox.
fields.summary: JIRA Issue Macro should support Anonymous JIRA users
Make search symbol clickable
Fails to export confluence page to pdf
Document the /status URL for Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41394].
  {panel}

This comes from a post on [Answers.Atlassian.com|https://answers.atlassian.com/] which I believe would be a valid feature.

[Is there a way to disable notifications in a space?|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/143231/is-there-a-way-to-disable-notifications-in-a-space?page=1#143633]

The use case would be that a company has multiple spaces but has a specific space which contains sensitive information that they would not like to have traveling over the internet via email.  However, they would still like to be able to have this ability available for spaces which do not contain sensitive information.  So the idea would be say an option in the space admin screens (say a check box) that when checked stops all emails related to that space from being created.

*workaround in the meantime*
Add a filter at the mail server level which blocks emails which contain links to the space in question.  For example 'http://localhost:8090/display/TEST' so they are still created by Confluence but never actually get sent.
fields.summary: Block emails/notifications from a specific space
Make more meaningful names for Confluence Space Exports
Data payload for notification emails.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41381].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In the Documentation theme when referencing page tree macro in customizing the sidebar, long page titles would automatically have a carriage return, allowing the sidebar to fit neatly on the side, without use of horizontal sliders.

Now that Documentation theme has been removed, our users are finding it difficult to limit the size of the sidebar or have a carriage return entered automatically.

h3. Suggested Solution
 Is there a solution to specify how wide the sidebar should be and enable an automatic carriage return?

h3. Workaround 
None as of yet
fields.summary: Default theme does not allow for automatic carriage return in page tree macro
Option to Show Phone Number When Hovering Username

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41376].
  {panel}

In JIRA we have a single select custom field called 'Severity'.  This field is a required field, so will pop-up in the JIRA-Macro when the issue is created from Confluence. We do not have a default value for this field selected: !image-2016-04-13-09-20-48-559.png|thumbnail! 

The behavior in JIRA is that on the create screen this value has by default no value, showing "None". The user has to choose a value. This is exactly the behavior we prefer; forcing the user to think about the value this field should have on creating an issue: 
 !image-2016-04-13-09-21-48-861.png|thumbnail! 

When a user creates an issue from our linked Confluence instance, the field is shown on the create screen, but already has a value assigned. So the user is not forced to select a value in this case: 
 !image-2016-04-13-09-23-44-462.png|thumbnail! 

We would expect to have the same behavior here.
fields.summary: JIRA issue marcro behaves different from JIRA on a custom field without default value

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41375].
  {panel}

Hi,

I have to store Confluence content in a database so it can be found in an external search web application. I can get the last modified date of e.g. a page via Confluence REST API and cql (e.g. /rest/api/content/search?cql=space=ds and lastModified > lastStoredTimeStamp and type = page). 

We want the process of storing confluence content be incremental (e.g. update only modified pages in the database). The problem is that a permission change doesn't update the last modified timestamp (e.g. history.lastUpdated field of the REST API answer). Is there a way to know permission changes via any Confluence API?

I need to answer the following questions:
Is there a way to know when a Confluence document is updated? Yes, via REST API
Is there a way to know when a Confluence document permission is updated? 
Is there a way to know when a Confluence user account changes e.g. joins/leaves a group?

Permission Changes (History) should be available via API.
fields.summary: A way to know permission changes via API

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41360].
  {panel}

Release of Ubuntu 16.04 LTS ('Xenial') is imminent (Apr 2016) and will use PostgreSQL 9.5 as it's default .

To allow Confluence to run in default configuration on a current Ubuntu Long Term Supported release (current by end of the month), Confluence should be tested/updated to support 9.5.  Currently 9.2 & 9.3 are listed here https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/supported-platforms-207488198.html.

{code}
ubuntu@ubuntu-xenial:~$ apt policy postgresql
postgresql:
  Installed: (none)
  Candidate: 9.5+173
  Version table:
     9.5+173 500
        500 http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu xenial/main amd64 Packages
{code}
fields.summary: Support PostreSQL 9.5

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41350].
  {panel}

Hi Atlassian

We keep on seeing use cases where people has structures like this, anywhere in the page hierarchy

{code}
ProjectX
    Documentation
       Motivation
       Requirements
    Deliverables
    Meetings
        August 1st
        July 1st
        KickOff 
{code}

And while this makes a lot of sense to them, it totally makes the pages absolutely "un-findable" by the search. A search like "ProjectX Meetings" would basically give nothing, and a search by "Meetings" just hundreds of results from as many spaces. ProjectX could also be the title of the space, but in this case the same effect will happen, only that at least users will see the title in the search results, even if the right one comes in the third page.

Of course we are telling people to write longer titles that include redundant information, but how far can one go? To find "ProjectX Requirements" one would like to include three hierarchical levels in the title! I find it a bit too much to ask to users

What I would like is for Confluence to include the page hierarchy as a field in the index, with a higher priority than the body content but perhaps less than the page title. It could a single field that itemises the ancentors up to the Space Title or just one field each for parent, grandparent and space title, in this case perhaps weighted differently.

But believe me, our users are not particularly happy and these cases are extremely common.
Thanks a lot for considering this.
Daniel
fields.summary: Confluence search should also use the space title and the parent page title in addition to the title of the page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41349].
  {panel}

Hi, 

Currently i've discovered how work the past due billing system of Confluence and it I have some ideas to improve it.

1 - When a payment bounce only 1 email reminder is sent to the financial contact. This could be increased, as an email can be easily missed from the finance user. 

2 - As an admin of our Atlassian instance, not member of finance, I was never made aware of any payment issue, and discovered it only when the instance was shut down. Admin (even users?) should be warned of this, as it impact all processes in the company when instance is shut down. 

3 - To resolve the payment issue, it seems that we need to connect with the account that is the financial contact in JIRA/Confluence. The issue is that the financial contact, in our case, is NOT an account in our instance - just a mailing list, so we can't connect to solve the payment issue. we are lock out the instance. It should be mandatory to select a user.
fields.summary: Billing Improvement for cloud version

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41348].
  {panel}

When a user requests access to a page an email is sent to the page creator. This contains a link to the Page and a link 'Grant Access' 
Some users will click on the page link (to see the page) and then add the restriction for that user. 
This results in 1. no email being sent to the requestor to confirm their request has been granted, and 2. more work for the page owner.

Consider removing the page link on the email AND changing 'Grant Access' to 'Review Access' (as access can be granted or denied after following this link)
fields.summary: Improve request access email notification

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41347].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As of now, even though [Application Links Integration|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/APPLINKS/Link+Atlassian+applications+to+work+together] has been enabled in Confluence, should the user try to [create JIRA issue by highlighting some text in Confluence page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/confluence-5-4-release-notes-414187879.html#Confluence5.4ReleaseNotes-CreateJIRAissuesfromConfluence], the user will then still be prompted to select the JIRA _Project_. 


h3. Suggested Solution
For JIRA _Project_ to be automatically selected once the user try to create JIRA issue from Confluence, should the JIRA _Project_ has been linked to that particular Confluence Space.
fields.summary: To Automatically Select JIRA Project on JIRA Issue Creation in Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41343].
  {panel}

When I try to setup Confluence on my Centos 7.2 with MariaDB 5.5.47 and Confluence 5.9.7 I reach this error
{quote}The following error(s) occurred:
    configuring.db.failed
    java.sql.SQLSyntaxErrorException: You have an error in your SQL syntax; check the manual that corresponds to your MariaDB server version for the right syntax to use near '%3DInnoDB' at line 1 Query is : set session autocommit=1,sql_mode='IGNORE_SPACE,STRICT_TRANS_TABLES',storage_engine%3DInnoDB{quote} The problem comes from: storage_engine%3DInnoDB
which must be: storage_engine=InnoDB
fields.summary: MariaDB/MySQL setup fails with url encoed symbol

Steps to replicate:
1. create Branch A.
2. Create Branch B from A.
3. Commit some codes to B.
4. Different commit from different authors to B.
7. Merge few author commit to A using B.
5. Create Pull request from B to A.
6. See the difference shown by stash. (capture A)
7. Now , click on create button and create it.
8. Now see the difference (capture B)

check capture A is same as capture B.
fields.summary: Difference shown in stash is not consistent while merge.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41331].
  {panel}

We are using Confluence 5.9.4 
System groups like jira-users, confluence-users, stash-users  are available for all users as they are the member in these System groups.
Currently a Space admin is able to search and add these system groups (available in Confluence application) in his space. 
This is a security risk as the "Space Administrator" in Confluence can add accidentally any other system specific groups and all other members in system specific groups (who do not require the access in the space) can also get access in the space.
So the space administrators should not add system groups in their spaces and there should be admin configuration to exclude application specific groups in group search screen.
Please implement the solution as this is a security issue.
fields.summary: Confluence should have admin configuration to exclude application specific groups in group search screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41329].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The Scatter Chart Macro expects a table like the XY Line Chart that is made of a sequence of values but Scatter charts are normally made to compare 2 data sets and form (x,y) cartesian dots to graph correlation.

Here are some link about scatter graphs:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scatter_plot
http://www.excel-easy.com/examples/scatter-chart.html
https://www.mathsisfun.com/data/scatter-xy-plots.html

At the moment, the chart is expecting a table like XY Line Chart:
 
|| || 12 || 14 || 23 ||
|Revenue|41.1|31.8|12.4|
|Expense|31.1|41.8|43.6|
That graphs:
XYline:     ---------------------------------------------- Scatter:
 !xyline.jpg|thumbnail!  !scatter1.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Problem
If one has a data set to compare such as 
Ice Cream Sales vs Temperature: from [this link|https://www.mathsisfun.com/data/scatter-xy-plots.html]

||Temperature °C	||Ice Cream Sales||
|14.2|	215|
|16.4|	325|
|11.9|	185|
|15.2|	332|
|18.5|	406|

The Scatter chart would fail to graph it.

If doing:
|Temperature °C |14.2|16.4|11.9|15.2|18.5|
|Ice Cream Sales|	215|	325|	185|	332|	406|

This is the result:
 !icecreamsales.jpg|thumbnail! 
Which is pretty close but confirms that the first row is considered the X axis and additional rows are sequence of Y values.
The Label is missing because it is not actually considered a data set.

So it looks like scatter chart is like the XYLine Chart but without the line and so it is not a true scatter graph that graphs (x,y) tuples to compare correlation between data sets.
fields.summary: Scatter chart of the Chart Macro expects incorrect data set

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41328].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Images in merged table cells are not exported to PDF correctly - the images appear to be constricted by the original cell size rather than the merged cell size in the PDF document.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud (1000.2.0) and also 6.0.0-OD-2016.01.1-0003

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a table with multiple columns and rows
# Merge two cells on a single row together and insert an image
# Insert some text into the other columns in the table
# Ensure the image you inserted earlier is almost as wide as the table (not just one of the columns)
# Save the page and note that the image 
# Click on the *...* icon and select *Export to PDF*

h3. Expected Results
The image will take up an amount of space corresponding to it's width on the original document. 

h3. Actual Results
The Image takes up space only as wide as a single column. 
 [^Export Test - current version.pdf]  

h3.Workaround
no workaround at this stage
fields.summary: Images in merged table cells are not exported to PDF correctly

*Suggested Output*

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41324].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Previewing of Excel and Word documents on IE 11, when we preview the file, it opens without issues the first time. Close the preview and attempt to preview again, and it keeps loading and never comes up.
Please refer the attached screecast

h3. Environment
This affects {{6.0.0-OD-2016.08.2-0008}}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login to Confluence using IE 11
# Attach a XLS file on the page
# Add the file to on the page
# Save page
# Try to preview this file multiple times.

h3. Expected Results
The file preview should work consistently each time we try to preview the files

h3. Actual Results
The Preview does not load for the second time. It works only for First time.
 
h3. Notes
This is not encountered on the current Cloud version OR the latest Confluence server version

h3.Workaround
Use compatibility mode to IE 10
fields.summary: File preview does not work consistently on IE 11

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41323].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently if the width of the browser is under 1240px the sidebar will overlap content (confluence but same AUI design in the Atlassian suite). 

i.e.

# Reduce window below 1240px width.
# Expand sidebar.
# It will overlap content. 
# Close window
# Sidebar will consistently over lap content.

h3. Suggested Solution
 Find a more graceful solution to scale for cases were a user works of one major screen and sizes several browser windows together. 

h3. Workaround 
Use a browser add-on like [Window Resizer|https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/window-resizer/kkelicaakdanhinjdeammmilcgefonfh?hl=en] for chrome.
fields.summary: Better AUI Design handling of overlapping content when width is under 1240px.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41318].
  {panel}

h4. Suggestion
There is a known issue with Confluence 5.9.x when running on MySQL 5.5 concerning indexing performance. The same way CONF-37953 was mentioned on the supported platforms documentation, we should highlight this issue as well: CONF-41030

On the contrary, there is another bug that was fixed in 5.9.5, where indexing was slow on MySQL 5.6: CONF-40544

Articles to add the above information to:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/database-setup-for-mysql-128747.html
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/supported-platforms-207488198.html
fields.summary: Documentation request: Add note of a known performance issue for MySQL 5.5

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41317].
  {panel}

h4. Problem
Our [AJP integration documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/using-apache-with-mod_jk-173681.html] does not mention adding the {{proxyName}}, {{proxyPort}}, {{scheme}} and {{secure}} parameters, however the same way as they are required [for Apache reverse-proxy integration|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/using-apache-with-mod_proxy-173669.html], they are needed here too.

These parameters are [available for the AJP connector as well|https://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-7.0-doc/config/ajp.html].

h4. Suggestion
Make sure to mention adding these parameters in our documentation, as missing those can lead to undesired UI behaviour and functionality loss.

Please also port the same suggestion to the related documentation for other products:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/configuring-apache-reverse-proxy-using-the-ajp-protocol-183468775.html
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/fisheye/using-ajp-with-fisheye-298976834.html (for FeCru, Jetty is the webserver, but [proxy parameters can and should be passed too|https://confluence.atlassian.com/fisheye/integrating-with-other-web-servers-298976937.html])
fields.summary: Documentation request: reverse proxy parameters for AJP connector
The Spaces List Macro ought to show the custom space logo instead of the default space logo
Allow use of custom themes in Confluence Cloud
Widget macro broken for flickr slideshow rendering
File structure is not user friendly
Cannot preview PSD and other types of design folders
Allow searching for content contributed or created by disabled user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41301].
  {panel}

Hi there!

Copying tables in confluence is very hard, sometimes its nearly impossible to properly select the table. Some of my colleagues were asking, why such a innovative and easy to use system like conflunece isn't able to provide a eays copy/cut/past table button in their editor (it was really arkward trying to promote confluence in their departmant and failing to to copy a simple table)

Copying or Cutting rows or collums isn't an option because you can't past them while not in a table (which you usually are not, when you want to cut/past a table on a different place of your site)

I really appreciat your work and I am sure, that such a feature *would help many many users*! If you have any more questions, don't hessitate to contact me!

Best wishes

Raphael
fields.summary: Please create a button in editor to cut/copy and past a table!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41299].
  {panel}

h4. Problem
There are a number of articles in the documentation space that are related to heap dump generation and garbage collection logging. These articles mention how to permanently change the related setting, but not how you can alter those while the application is running.

h4. Suggestion
I have created a KB explaining how some of the related parameters can be changed runtime. Please link to this article from the related documentation: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/KB/How+to+change+JVM+arguments+at+runtime+to+avoid+application+restart].

h5. Reference/affected articles
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/generating-a-heap-dump-219024032.html
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/stashkb/how-to-generate-a-heap-dump-717062495.html
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-get-a-java-heap-dump-213523770.html
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/using-memory-dumps-to-analyze-outofmemoryerrors-227416007.html
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/enterprise/garbage-collection-gc-tuning-guide-461504616.html
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/using-garbage-collection-logs-to-analyze-jira-application-performance-227416009.html
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf53/garbage-collector-performance-issues-411109189.html
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-enable-garbage-collection-gc-logging-300813751.html
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/garbage-collector-performance-issues-200707997.html
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/enterprise/garbage-collection-gc-tuning-guide-461504616.html
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHKB/Fix+Out+of+Memory+errors (+changed+ but pending for details on default location for garbage location log since Xloggc cannot be set at runtime)
fields.summary: Documentation request: Mention runtime JVM parameter change option in related docs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41298].
  {panel}

Currently on Confluence, all user account can be browse when: 
# Mention user on a page
# Add a task for a user 
# Edit page restriction
# Edit space permissions 
# Edit global permission

It will be useful to have a configurable scope to limit the user browse so that the administrator can have a better control of what are the group of user that can be browse by specific users our groups.
fields.summary: Confluence add the user browse scope

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41296].
  {panel}

_This is for Confluence Cloud (6.0.0-OD-2016.12.4)_
h3. Problem Definition
A customer is trying to set up his Confluence instance so that every new user will by default have the _Subscribe to new follower notifications_ checked as well as _Autowatch_ and all the other settings unchecked. It is currently only possible to do so by asking each user to set these settings themselves in their Confluence profile email settings.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great if an administrator could set the default values for the email settings in a Confluence user profile so that each new user will have these settings from the start (currently it is only possible to configure the recommended email updates).
fields.summary: As an administrator, I want to be able to set default values for user Email settings

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41293].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As of now, there is no _Filter_ feature in _Roadmap Planner_ macro yet. All of the information would be displayed in the UI. This would be rather confusing for the users as the roadmap's dataset grows bigger.

h3. Suggested Solution
To implement _Filter_ feature for this plugin e.g. based on types of lanes, Confluence user groups, etc. Please refer to the attached screenshots.
fields.summary: Implementation of Filter Features in Roadmap Planner Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41292].
{panel}
On the confluence wiki, the somewhat weird scissors icon is used as favicon for each page. When I've had a page open for a while, and someone updates the page, a notification appears in the bottom right of the page suggesting I refresh the page to see the update(s). When that happens, is it possible the favicon could be updated to show that the page was updated?

In the rare cases when I have so few tabs I can see anything more than the icon (my usual use case is 35-50 tabs open in chrome, so sometimes I don’t even have 
the icons showing), I can see the (#) in the tab title, but this request is to update the icon like gmail does for unread emails (it’s buried in the gmail options somewhere):

I’ve seen other websites that do this too for things where count matters, but I can’t think of them right now. Twitter maybe?
An icon change to show there was an update without a count would be good enough since I don’t really care how many updates the page has gotten, just that it has been updated or not since I last read it.
fields.summary: Enable Confluence Favicon to show page and space change status

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41291].
  {panel}

Unless you're watching a page with inline comments, or have been specifically @ mentioned in the comment, it's almost impossible to see the light yellow highlighting that indicates there's an inline comment on a page. 

Can you either make the highlighting much darker, so it's easier to tell if there's an inline comments?
Alternatively, and I think preferably, add a "show all inline comments" option to the tools menu? It follows a similar logic to being able to see the "resolved comments" in the tools menu. 

thanks!
fields.summary: Cannot see inline comments
Create Template History similar to Page History
New Blog posts not showing when using Blog Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41278].
  {panel}

*Current Mobile State*
Currently, the desktop version of Confluence uses a site-wide favicon and space logos. The mobile plugin does not use these settings, rather using an Atlasssian logo, seen in the following HTML Source header fragment:

{quote}<link rel="apple-touch-icon-precomposed" sizes="57x57" href="/wiki/s/en_GB/6437/4f3a11a8e79855052f86fe30466d81ee677d8ec4/_/download/resources/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-mobile/images/apple-touch-icon-57x57-precomposed.png" />
<link rel="apple-touch-icon-precomposed" sizes="72x72" href="/wiki/s/en_GB/6437/4f3a11a8e79855052f86fe30466d81ee677d8ec4/_/download/resources/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-mobile/images/apple-touch-icon-72x72-precomposed.png" />
<link rel="apple-touch-icon-precomposed" sizes="114x114" href="/wiki/s/en_GB/6437/4f3a11a8e79855052f86fe30466d81ee677d8ec4/_/download/resources/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-mobile/images/apple-touch-icon-114x114-precomposed.png" />
<link rel="apple-touch-icon-precomposed" sizes="144x144" href="/wiki/s/en_GB/6437/4f3a11a8e79855052f86fe30466d81ee677d8ec4/_/download/resources/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-mobile/images/apple-touch-icon-144x144-precomposed.png" />{quote}

*Issue*
When deploying an iOS Web Clip to iPads, an icon is supplied in the MDM payload. The icon was created to represent the space which it links to, and more than one Web Clip is deployed.

Once opened in Safari, by default in Mobile mode, the icon will be replaced on the home screen by the Atlasssian icon specified with "apple-touch-icon-precomposed".

*Expected Behavior*
The space logo, which is also square in proportion, should be used as the precomposed icon. A space administrator should set the space icon to represent the same image that is supplied in the MDM web clip payload, so that when the web clip is opened, the icon does not change. This allows multiple web clips to be supplied to users' iDevices pointing to different spaces.
fields.summary: Use Space Logo as Mobile "apple-touch-icon-precomposed"
Placeholder text in the Livesearch Macro is inconsistent cross browser

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

h3. Problem Definition
As of now, the timeline of Confluence _Roadmap Planner_ macro is limited to 5 years. Please refer to the attached screenshot.

h3. Suggested Solution
To support wider range of timeline for this macro to provide more flexibility to the users.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41273].
  {panel}

Limit the number of attachment versions attached in the Confluence page. User may able to set the version limit to a specific attachment.

For example, set the version limit for image_attachment_1 to 5 versions only

Output:  *Image_attachment_1*
         - Version 5 (current)
         - Version 4
         - Version 3
         - Version 2
         - Version 1

Oldest version would be automatically deleted once new version is uploaded
fields.summary: Limit Attachment Versions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41271].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When a user has drafts connected to non-existing spaces, they will get a stracktrace when viewing their Drafts.

This is sometimes the results of this bug:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-41150

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# With a user, create a draft
# In some situations, the space it was created in may be deleted, but not the draft.
# Click 'Profile >> Drafts'

h3. Expected Results
The user can still access their drafts.

h3. Actual Results
An error page is shown with this stacktrace
{noformat}

2016-04-01 13:09:09.751778500 	at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.PropertyExecutor.execute(PropertyExecutor.java:142)
2016-04-01 13:09:09.751779500 	at org.apache.velocity.util.introspection.UberspectImpl$VelGetterImpl.invoke(UberspectImpl.java:529)
2016-04-01 13:09:09.751799500 	at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTIdentifier.execute(ASTIdentifier.java:198)
2016-04-01 13:09:09.751799500 	... 388 more
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes

If you want to check only the affected users first, you can use this:
{code:sql}
select distinct um.username as "creator" from content c join user_mapping um on c.creator = um.user_key where c.contenttype = 'DRAFT' and c.draftspacekey not in (SELECT spacekey FROM SPACES) order by um.username;
{code}


h3.Workaround
# Find all drafts connected to non-existing spaces in the database:
{code:sql}
select c.contentid, c.title, c.draftspacekey, um.username as "creator" from content c join user_mapping um on c.creator = um.user_key where c.contenttype = 'DRAFT' and c.draftspacekey not in (SELECT spacekey FROM SPACES) order by c.creator;
{code}
# For every response, log in as the 'creator' and access this (won't work if you log in as any user other than the creator):
{noformat}
https://instance.atlassian.net/wiki/json/deletedraft.action?draftId=<draft_id>&atl_token=#form_xsrfToken()
{noformat}
#* Replace the '<draft_id>' for the 'contentid'.
# If it works, that line should no longer appear in the select above and this should be shown in the page:
{noformat}
{}
{noformat}
fields.summary: Stack Trace Generated When Trying to View Drafts linked to a non existent Space
Customize the livesearch macro to populate results from partial words

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41266].
  {panel}

Using Confluence 5.9.6

I have a page opened in edit mode.

I type some text in the page.

I do something else than saving my edits right now.

After some time, my session times out.

I get the login screen.

I come back to the page being in edit mode :
* without my modifications stored (no draft)
* the title of the page is empty

=> I lost my edits.
fields.summary: session times out => the draft is lost + the title of the page is lost

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41265].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Description

When users create a page from existing Template, they select the preferred Template and click _Create_ button.

h3. Suggested Resolution

It would be great to have the ability for customized wizard window where users have the flexibility about what fields they can display. 
- !image-2016-04-04-19-30-23-295.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to have customized wizard for a page created from Template

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41259].
  {panel}

We still need the ability to add custom fields to be displayed when in Confluence we add a link to a JIRA issue. Right now, when we add a JIRA issue link, we cannot add any fields that might be vital for us to display (aside from the issue title and current status, which get displayed by default).

In these other JIRA tickets, users have been asking for the same thing, but those issues are marked as "resolved" without an actual resolution. Several are marked as duplicates, and the one that is marked as "fixed" did not result in an actual fix:

* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-27554
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-27033
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-22575 <-- The one marked as "fixed" but is not actually fixed
fields.summary: Add ability to add custom fields to inline JIRA links.

fields.description: version 5.7.4 affected

Add a sort function for Two dimensional chart.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41248].
  {panel}

Hi,
I have a problem with using the ”edit in office” button. When I am pressing the “edit in office” button an error message will appear, see the attachment.
Some of my colleagues have the same problem but for most of my colleagues it is working fine.

I have checked if there is any differences in confluence version between the people that it is working for and the ones that it is not working for, But there are not any differences in version. 

I am using confluence version 5.7.5 and using Microsoft Outlook 2010 and windows 7 enterprise.

Best regards Lars
fields.summary: the "edit in office" button does not working

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41247].

I'm facig problem once I create new page inside our T-systems site powered by Atlassian.
Example: parent site: https://websso.t-systems.com/qbase/display/PKA/CoE+VLS+HANA

So I created an subsite but I'm getting error message trying to access it:
https://websso.t-systems.com/qbase/display/PKA/Reset+of+Service+Account+HANA-SAP%3CSID%3E-S

Here another sites I created with same error:
https://websso.t-systems.com/qbase/display/PKA/%5BHINT%5D+HANA%3A+HANA+Studio+is+not+accessible+-+Access+via+HDBAmin+tool
https://websso.t-systems.com/qbase/display/PKA/%5BHINT%5D+HANA%3A+HANA+Trace+files

But once trying to display content, I'm getting error message:


Störung der Applikation - Application incidents
Liebe Nutzerin, lieber Nutzer,

die Enterprise 2.0 Applikationen sind momentan leider nicht erreichbar. Es ist eine Störung
aufgetreten an deren Behebung wir mit Hochdruck arbeiten.

Wir bitten um Ihr Verständnis. 

Dear users,

Sorry. Enterprise 2.0 applications are currently not available. An incident has occurred and we are working hard to solve the issue as soon as possible.

We apologize for any inconvenience caused.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41246].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Clicking your profile picture then on the _Recently Viewed_ option will display a dialog listing all the recently viewed pages, but there isn't a way o clear this list if the user wants it.
h3. Suggested Solution
Add an option to clear all pages on this recently viewed dialog.
fields.summary: Add option to clear the Recently Viewed dialog
Switch CodeSyntax Highlighter to Highlight.JS
Restrict a live search macro to more than one space
Restrict the Livesearch macro to a page and its children pages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-41236].
  {panel}

h4. Pain Point:
Today, if you bookmark a confluence page, it saves the confluence page based on the name of the page title, such as "Dummy+test+page".

However, if someone changes the title of the page, the bookmark link is basically broken.  If you bookmarked it, or sent that link to someone else via email, you can't find it directly.  Confluence fortunately has a way to ask you if you really were looking for this other page, but I think that's an unnecessary step.

h4. Proposed Solution
Since you already keep a permanent unique link for each confluence page regardless of the page title (that's revealed via Control + k), why not just use that as the browser url instead of the one based on the page title?
fields.summary: Show Permanent Confluence Page link in browser URL not the subject of the confluence page
